newsitem.title: SPAIN: Madrid stocks weaken in tandem with bonds.
newsitem.headline: Madrid stocks weaken in tandem with bonds.

text.p: Madrid stocks closed lower in lacklustre trade, dragged lower by a drop in bonds triggered by a fall in German bunds below important technical support. * General index fell 1.89 points, 0.53 percent, to 352.14. * Ibex-35 index lost 24.45 points, 0.61 percent, to 3,997.45. * Telefonica fell 10 pesetas to 2,255 with more than two million shares traded. Repsol lost 20 pesetas to 4,070 with 518,000 shares exchanging hands.
Traders said expectations of a cut in the German repo rate on Thursday had fallen after a stronger-than-expected Ifo July business climate index.
The Ibex-35 index broke below support at 4,000, but traders saw nearby support at 3,980.
Volume was 25 billion pesetas, up from recent sessions, of which a large part was in Telefonica, Iberdrola and Repsol.
There was some arbitrage activity in morning trade, with traders selling Ibex stocks and buying futures, but this slackened off later in the session.
Pryca gained 45 pesetas to 3,070, with 456,000 shares traded, on talk of strong first half results and rumours that Carrefour was to buy out the Spanish retailer.
